page.title: 13Banwell Caves
page.content: There are two main caves in Banwell. In one of the caves they found animal bones. Some of the bones are still stacked in the cave, while others are in Taunton Museum. In the other there are many stalagmites. The caves belong to Mr and Mrs. Sargent and Mr. and Mrs. Haines. They live 30 metres above the caves. Unlike the caves at Cheddar and Burrington,they open on to the summit of hill instead of a ravine. The caves are appproached by a little grotto from the grounds of the house. There is no lighting as such in the cave and candles and torches have to be used to enable people to see. The caves were discovered in 1824 by Mr. Beard, who stacked all the bones along the walls of the caves. There are remains of extinct animals.
